intro: Fimbristylis albescens, commonly known as the white-haired sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this species thrives in wetland and marshy environments. The plant produces white or pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in spikelets. Fimbristylis albescens is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support aquatic ecosystems.
